Frequently Asked Questions

Updated daily. Mostly because new questions arise from new incidents.

Is Chairman Meow Zedong actually an AI piloting a genetically engineered cat body?
No. Absolutely not. The Chairman is a real cat with real fur and real opinions about your tattoo design. The fact that he types 140 WPM and speaks fluent Mandarin is simply the result of good breeding. Next question.
[EDITOR'S NOTE: Three keyboards were knocked off desks during the writing of this response.]
Why is there always jazz?
The Schr√∂dinger's Cats have a 200-year residency contract signed during the station's founding. We've consulted 4 lawyers. The contract is airtight. We've tried to negotiate. The bassist just stared at us. We've accepted our fate. You should too.
[A cymbal crash is heard in the background. Two ink bottles fall off Shelf C-4.]
What happened with the Cosmic Catnip Anesthetic?
We briefly used catnip-derived anesthetic because it was "organic" and "locally sourced" (from the hydroponic bay on Deck 12). It worked great on the cats. It worked differently on humans. Client #4417 described the experience as "becoming one with the concept of furniture." We've since switched to standard anesthetic. Client #4417 still calls us sometimes. She misses being a couch.
Can I bring my dog to the station?
No.
[The entire Kommittee has left the room. This FAQ session is now over. The jazz has gotten louder.]
What's the deal with the 4th dimension portal?
During a particularly intense saxophone solo on stardate 2342.187, our lead saxophonist Coltrane (yes, he legally changed his name) hit a frequency that apparently corresponds to the resonance threshold of spacetime in this sector. A portal opened. Things came through. We don't discuss what things. The portal now opens and closes roughly in sync with jazz intensity. We've applied for a research grant. It was denied. We applied again listing it as "ventilation."
Who is Kevin?
Kevin is our human intern. He applied for a 3-month graphic design internship in 2342. It is now 2342. He has been here for what he describes as "either 6 months or 6 years, time doesn't work right near the portal." He maintains the website, feeds the Kommittee, and has developed a thousand-yard stare that customers find "concerning." Kevin is fine. Kevin is always fine. Kevin would like you to know the website looks best in dark mode. There is no light mode. There never was.
